p: Nason Maani is a biomedical scientist, public health researcher and 2019–2020 Harkness Fellow in Healthcare Policy and Practice at Boston University School of Public Health. He is an Assistant Professor in the Faculty of Public Health and Policy at the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine, an Advisor to the Rockefeller-Boston University 3-D Commission on Determinants of health, Data science, and Decision making. He is a Fellow of the Royal Society of the Arts. His research interests center on the commercial and structural determinants of health and their broader impacts on knowledge generation, discourse, and equity.
